context.p: To debug the transformation scenario, follow these steps:

step.cmd: , go to XML XML Catalog , click Add, and select the file located at \plugins\org.dita.pdf2\cfg\catalog.xml.
Open the map in the DITA Maps Manager and create a transformation scenario.
Edit the scenario, go to the Parameters tab and change the value of the clean.temp parameter to no.
Open the stage1.xml file located in the temporary directory and format and indent it.

Create a transformation scenario for this XML file by associating the topic2fo_shell_fop.xsl stylesheet located at \plugins\org.dita.pdf2.fop\xsl\fo\topic2fo_shell_fop.xsl. If you are specifically using the RenderX XEP or Antenna House FO processors to build the PDF output, you should use the XSL stylesheets topic2fo_shell_xep.xsl or topic2fo_shell_axf.xsl located in the corresponding plugin folders.

info.note: For validation purposes, you need to add the main debugged stylesheet (usually topic2fo_shell_fop.xsl) to the Main Files folder in the ProjectProject Explorer view.

step.cmd: In the transformer drop-down menu, select the Saxon EE XSLT processor (the same processor used when the DITA-OT transformation is executed).

Click the Parameters button and set the work.dir.url parameter to point to the URL location of the folder containing the stage1.xml file. Its value should have a URL syntax like this: file://c:/path/to/folderContainingStage1File/

You need to reference the extra common used JAR libraries by clicking the Extensions button and use wildcards to add a reference to all libraries in this folder: DITA-OT\plugins\com.oxygenxml.common\lib\*.
Apply the transformation to continue the debugging process.

info.note: For externally configured DITA Open Toolkit installations or when using custom plugins based on the base PDF2 plugin, the paths to resources described above may need to be adjusted accordingly.
